customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
At the tavern known as The Rusty Rudder, Genius Invokation TCG can also be a sort of mental "good wine," giving some customers a sort of joy that even drinks cannot guarantee. Chief Mate Lasselin knows this well.
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: You will not use your own deck, but a preset deck named "Torrent of Proliferating Organisms" instead.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

customize.name: Furina
customize.desc:
"Endless Solo of Solitude" Furina

Perpetual muse of chansons and rondeaux.

customize.name: Lyney
customize.desc:
"Spectacle of Phantasmagoria" Lyney

Those flowers in the mirror... who are they for?

customize.name: Neuvillette
customize.desc:
"Ordainer of Inexorable Judgment" Neuvillette

He who looks down on all that are haughty.

customize.name: Guardian of Apep's Oasis
customize.desc:
Wisdom's End: Guardian of Apep's Oasis

Apep found itself swallowed alone amidst the scenery of the catastrophe. All the people, gods, dragons, beasts, birds, and fish. All memories, wisdom, words, and hatred were ground into colorless dust, and the last of the moonlight burned away into a rain of pale fire, falling on the barren land.

...

Apep once deemed the bottom of the sea of sand to be its grave, not the palace of a dispossessed king. The poison of "wisdom" would soon free Apep from the hatred and anger festering within it over countless moons. Apep had grown weary of the colorless apocalypse. Then, finally, the young god and the golden Traveler let it recall once again, even though the verdant land it once ruled had been reduced to this gilded wasteland, even though Apep and its many offspring had grown twisted and wretched to secure their continued survival therein, Apep still treasured the sight and scenes of the oasis sparkling in its heart.

customize.name: Xinyan
customize.desc:
"Blazing Riff" Xinyan

Time to rock!

customize.name: Millennial Pearl Seahorse
customize.desc:
Millennial Pearl Seahorse

One of the two sovereigns standing at the apex of the Fontemer Aberrants. Poets and authors view it as a proud and noble creature, thus bestowing it with its high-flown title.

customize.name: A Thousand Young
customize.desc:
Guardian of Apep's Oasis: A Thousand Young

Apep once walked through an ocean of fragrant grass, gigantic trees, and unimaginably long vines like a fish with its many offspring swimming through the sea. Finally, the grass, trees, and vines withered and turned to dust, while countless beings as minute as grains of gravel built a fragile kingdom upon Apep's land.

Apep and its offspring made the sea of sand rage like boiling water and swept houses down as if they were falling leaves. Until the day when the new Lord of Sand reconciled with the king who lost their homeland, the dunes under the sun belonged to humanity, while the dragon's oasis remained in the hearts of the dragons.

Apep shared the knowledge of evolution with its many offspring, because spreading knowledge ensures dissemination while the stagnation of hoarded wisdom courted only decay. Till the day the promise between it and the Lord of Sand was finally attained, with ultimate wisdom claimed. Henceforth, it reaped only sights of oblivion, of an endless calamity...

customize.name: Kusava
customize.desc:
Kusava

Kusava, Kusava~♪

Memories and dreams are full of power.

It is the fruit of flowering plants, and also the seed of new life.

They are the temporary dwelling place of Aranara memories, and they give Aranara strength.

In Every House a Stove

"The Stove God cared for the people, turning himself into minions who went into every home, fostering food and solidarity alike."

customize.name: Mushroom Pizza
customize.desc:
Mushroom Pizza

They say that a researcher once used very precise calculations to uncover the "fairest way to cut pizza," but as the process is far too bothersome, basically no one uses it…

customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...
